page.title: 03 Rivers.
page.content: { There are many small streams which flow from the bottom of the chalk hills in our area. The main river however is the River Frome which flows from West to Easy through Bradford Peverell, skirting Charminster and flowing through Dorchester on it's Northern boundary. Along the Frome are lush watermeadows and quite large herds of cows graze; mostly black and white Freisians. The other river is the River Cerne which flows from the hills near Cerne Abbas through Charminster. It then passes along the watermeadows parallel with the A37 before joining the Frome at the bottom of the Grove in Dorchester, just by Grey's Bridge.The rivers are clean with moorhens,ducks and a great variety of wildlife.
